item.title: 9 Most Influential Crypto Cities in the World in 2024 - Decrypt
item.description:
9 Most Influential Crypto Cities in the World in 2024

Publication Date: 2024

Source: Decrypt

Cryptocurrencies have established a stronger foothold in global financial ecosystems, and cities worldwide are vying to be hubs for blockchain innovation and adoption. This year, the industry has progressed, from regulatory clarity to a thriving startup culture. Here are nine cities shaping the crypto landscape in 2024.

  • Berlin, Germany: Germany clarified tax rules for crypto, enhancing its status as Europe’s premier crypto hub.
  • Singapore: Expanded regulatory sandbox provides opportunities for fintech startups in tokenized assets and DeFi.
  • Dubai, UAE: Issued comprehensive crypto guidelines, attracting global exchanges.
  • Tokyo, Japan: Implemented tax reforms to incentivize institutional investment in crypto.
  • Sydney, Australia: Hosted Aus Crypto Con, showcasing local innovations despite slow regulatory development.
  • San Francisco, US: Silicon Valley continues to foster disruptive crypto projects with renewed venture funding.
  • Miami, US: Remains dynamic with events enhancing its crypto hub status.
  • New York City, US: Strengthened blockchain hub with tighter regulations, attracting firms like Circle.
  • Hong Kong: Proposed tax exemptions for crypto gains to enhance its wealth management appeal.
“Berlin is solidifying its place as Europe’s premier crypto hub for 2025,” said Hannes Graah of Zeal.

item.title: These Crypto Industry Stars Shone Brightest in 2024 - Decrypt
item.description:
These Crypto Industry Stars Shone Brightest in 2024

Publication Date: 2024 Source: Decrypt

The digital assets industry smashed records and reached new milestones in 2024, with Bitcoin exceeding $100,000 and many emerging stars in the crypto space making headlines.

  • Sasha Plotvinov’s Notcoin attracted 35 million users, boosting crypto gaming.
  • Dylan Abruscato's Crypto: The Game gained popularity, reaching a prize pool of $115,000.
  • Crypto Twitter influencer Ansem rose to fame with 600,000 followers.
  • Jack Lu led a revival of NFT trading at Magic Eden.
  • Iggy Azalea successfully launched her meme coin, $MOTHER, creating a Web3 community.
“The token's relative success is supposedly a product of Azalea’s dedication to building a Web3 community.”

This year marked significant growth in the cryptocurrency and Web3 sectors as various projects captured public attention and generated discussions among users and investors.

item.title: Market Trading Guide: Muthoot Finance, Hindalco Industries are among 4 stock recommendations for Wednesday - The Economic Times
item.description:
Market Trading Guide: Stock Recommendations for Wednesday

Date: Dec 31, 2024 Source: Economic Times

The article discusses stock recommendations by analysts for Wednesday, highlighting significant trends and trading strategies following the last trading session of 2024.

  • Indian stock benchmarks closed slightly down with the S&P BSE Sensex at 78,139.01 and Nifty at 23,644.80.
  • For the year, Nifty recorded a 9% rise while Sensex saw an 8% increase.
  • Analysts suggest potential targets and strategies for four key stocks: Muthoot Finance, Laurus Labs, Aurobindo Pharma, and Hindalco Industries.
"If Nifty moves above 23,700, it could advance towards 23,900-24,000. On the lower end, support is placed at 23,550." - Rupak De, Senior Technical Analyst at LKP Securities

Investors are advised to carefully consider these stock recommendations as the market transitions into the new year.

item.title: Easy Trip Planners co-founder Nishant Pitti offloads 1.4% stake for ₹78 crore; Shares close 6.92% lower | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Nishant Pitti of Easy Trip Planners Sells 1.4% Stake for ₹78 Crore Amid Market Decline

Publication Date: December 31, 2023

Source: PTI

Co-founder and promoter Nishant Pitti sold a 1.4% stake in Easy Trip Planners for ₹78 crore, leading to a decline in the company's share price.

  • Nishant Pitti sold 4.99 crore shares at an average price of ₹15.68.
  • Pitti's stake in the company decreased from 14.21% to 12.8%.
  • The total promoter stake dropped to 48.97%.
  • Shares closed 6.92% lower at ₹15.87 after trading.
  • Pitti previously sold a 14% stake for ₹920 crore in September 2023.
“The sharp decline in Easy Trip Planner shares came amid reports that the company’s promoter and co-founder Nishant Pitti will sell off his remaining 14.21% stake.”

This recent transaction highlights market volatility and investor reactions to insider selling.

item.title: Stocks to Watch on January 1: Piramal Enterprises, Thomas Cook, Kirloskar Industries and more - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Stocks to Watch on January 1: Piramal Enterprises, Thomas Cook, Kirloskar Industries and more

Date: January 1, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

Today, several stocks are highlighted for attention, including Piramal Enterprises, Thomas Cook, Kirloskar Industries, Kalpataru Projects, and ITD Cementation.

  • Piramal Enterprises: Invested ₹1,000 crore in its subsidiary, Piramal Capital & Housing Finance Ltd for general corporate purposes.
  • Thomas Cook: Experiencing a cyberattack, the company is investigating and mitigating the effects.
  • Kirloskar Industries: Plans to challenge a SEBI directive regarding disclosure of family settlement documents.
  • Kalpataru Projects: Secured new orders worth ₹1,011 crore across various sectors.
  • ITD Cementation: Awarded a ₹1,648 crore marine contract for the Vadhvan Port project in Maharashtra.
“The project involves constructing nearshore reclamation and shore protection for the greenfield Vadhvan Port, which will be India’s largest deep-water port.”

This summary reflects key developments for stocks to watch today, highlighting significant investments and strategic actions by notable companies.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 1 Live Updates: Issue subscribed over 17 times; Check GMP, review, other key details | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 1 Live Updates: Issue subscribed over 17 times

Publication Date: 31 Dec 2024

Source: LiveMint

Indo Farm Equipment Ltd's IPO was fully subscribed within hours of opening amid strong demand, aiming to raise ₹260.15 crore from the book-built issue.

  • The IPO opened for subscription on December 31 and will close on January 2.
  • Price band set at ₹204 to ₹215 per share.
  • On day 1, the IPO was subscribed 17.71 times, with retail investors' portion subscribed 18.55 times.
  • Gross number of applications received: 15,00,14,832 for 84,70,000 shares.
  • Funds raised will be used for enhancing production capacity, loan repayments, and general corporate purposes.
“The issue is priced at a P/E ratio of 51.8x on the upper price band. However, given the company's improving sales and favourable trends, we recommend a ‘SUBSCRIBE’ rating for the issue.” - Palak Devadiga, Research Analyst, StoxBox

The strong interest in the Indo Farm Equipment IPO reflects investor confidence amid possible future growth in the agricultural equipment sector.

item.title: BSE, NSE Holidays 2025: Is Stock Market Open On 1st January? - News18
item.description:
BSE, NSE Holidays 2025: Is Stock Market Open On 1st January?

Last Updated: January 01, 2025, 00:36 IST

As the new year begins, investors are curious if Indian stock markets will operate on January 1, 2025. The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and the National Stock Exchange (NSE) have confirmed that trading will proceed as usual on this day, including various market segments.

Key Points:

  • The stock markets will remain open for trading on January 1, 2025.
  • Only one stock market holiday in January, which is on January 26 (Republic Day).
  • The BSE and NSE provided a holiday schedule detailing 14 non-trading days throughout 2025.
  • Holidays include significant dates like Maha Shivaratri, Holi, Good Friday, and Diwali.

“The holiday schedule ensures that traders and investors have ample time to prepare their trading strategies around non-working days.”

This information is crucial for traders and investors in planing their activities around holiday schedules for better preparation.

item.title: Small savings schemes: Interest rates on PPF, SSY, SCSS remain unchanged for January-March quarter; Check rates | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Small savings schemes: Interest rates on PPF, SSY, SCSS remain unchanged for January-March quarter; Check rates

Date: December 31, 2024

Source: Live Mint

The central government has announced that the interest rates for various small savings schemes will remain unchanged for the January to March quarter of FY 2024-25, marking the fourth consecutive quarter with no adjustments.

  • The interest rates for Public Provident Fund (PPF) and National Savings Certificate (NSC) are kept at 7.1 per cent and 7.7 per cent, respectively.
  • Kisan Vikas Patra (KVP) interest rate is set at 7.5 per cent.
  • The Senior Citizen Savings Scheme (SCSS) will continue at 8.2 per cent.
  • The Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY) maintains an interest rate of 8.2 per cent.
  • Post Office Monthly Income Scheme (PO-MIS) offers an interest rate of 7.4 per cent.
  • Deposits made in the five-year recurring deposit (RD) scheme will earn 6.7 per cent.
The government notifies the interest rates on small savings schemes every quarter, based on recommendations from the Shyamala Gopinath Committee.

This stability in interest rates comes as a strategy to promote consistent savings behavior across various demographics, especially among senior citizens and parents saving for their daughters' future.

item.title: Interest rates on small savings schemes remain unchanged - The Hindu
item.description:
Interest Rates on Small Savings Schemes Remain Unchanged

Date: December 31, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The Centre has decided to keep the interest rates for small savings schemes unchanged for the January to March 2025 quarter, marking the fourth consecutive quarter without change.

  • The interest rates for schemes like PPF and NSC are recalibrated quarterly based on government securities yields.
  • The government had previously increased rates on small savings schemes by 70-250 basis points since Q3 of 2022-23.
  • The Sukanya Samriddhi Account Scheme rate is now at 8.2%, while PPF remains at 7.1% since April 2020.
The government increased rates cumulatively between 70-250 basis points over the last year.

This status quo in interest rates reflects stabilizing financial conditions, with certain schemes maintaining their appeal for savers.

item.title: Citichem India IPO booked 414 times on final day; check allotment and listing date - Upstox
item.description:
Citichem India IPO Surges 414 Times on Final Day; Allotment and Listing Dates Announced

Publication Date: December 31, 2024 | Source: Upstox

The IPO of chemicals supplier Citichem India Limited saw immense demand on its final bidding day, leading to a total subscription of 414.4 times the available shares.

Key details include:

  • The IPO received applications for nearly 70.78 crore shares against a net issue size of 17.08 lakh equity shares.
  • Retail investors accounted for 543.18 times of their segment's quota.
  • The company plans to use the IPO proceeds for property acquisition and vehicle purchases.
  • Share allotment will be announced on January 1, 2025, with shares listed on January 3.
"Citichem India Limited supplies organic and inorganic chemicals, bulk drugs, and food chemicals, primarily focusing on direct supplies to pharmaceutical players."

The Citichem India IPO reflects strong investor interest, and its proceeds will bolster company growth and expansion efforts.

item.title: Latest Post Office Schemes interest rates: PPF, SCSS, SSY, other small savings schemes rates announced for - The Economic Times
item.description:
Interest Rates Unchanged for Small Savings Schemes in January-March 2025 Quarter

Date: January 2025 Source: Ministry of Finance

No changes have been announced in the interest rates for small savings schemes for the January-March 2025 quarter, meaning rates will remain unchanged for the final quarter of FY 2024-25.

  • Current interest rates are maintained across various schemes such as PPF, SCSS, and SSY.
  • Investors will earn specific rates on different schemes, with Senior Citizen Savings Scheme offering 8.2% and PPF at 7.1%.
  • The last adjustment to the interest rates occurred in January-March 2024, with no changes since April 2024.
"Interest rates on small savings schemes like PPF, NSC remain unchanged for January-March quarter", said the Department of Economic Affairs, Finance Ministry.

Given current economic trends, it is unlikely that significant changes to the rates will happen in the near future, especially considering the cautious approach of the government.

item.title: Companies News Today Live Updates on December 31, 2024: Blinkit CEO Albinder Dhindsa might deliver your next order | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Companies News Today highlights on December 31, 2024: WhatsApp UPI: NPCI removes user onboarding restriction limits, company aims to hike user base

Date: 31 Dec 2024

Source: LiveMint

The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has removed user onboarding restriction limits for the WhatsApp UPI facility, allowing the company to expand its user base significantly.

  • NPCI aims to include more users in the UPI system, enhancing its accessibility.
  • This decision is expected to impact numerous potential users across India.
“With this change, we anticipate a substantial increase in user participation and transaction volume,” said a spokesperson for NPCI.

This move reflects WhatsApp's ongoing efforts to capture a larger share of the digital payments market in India.

item.title: Upcoming IPOs 2025: Reliance Industries to HDFC Bank - THESE listed parents eyeing subsidiary's NSE, BSE listing - ET Now
item.description:
Upcoming IPOs 2025: Reliance Industries to HDFC Bank - THESE listed parents eyeing subsidiary's NSE, BSE listing

Updated: Dec 31, 2024 18:20 IST

A lot is in store for market enthusiasts in the coming year. Several listed parents ranging from Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries to largest private lender HDFC Bank are eyeing a listing of their subsidiaries in the coming year, and will collectively raise over a whopping Rs 1 lakh crore.

  • HDFC Bank: Planning to list HDB Financial Services with a Rs 12,500 crore IPO.
  • Reliance Industries: Targeting a public listing for Reliance Jio, potentially the largest IPO in India.
  • Prestige Estate: Looking to list subsidiary Prestige Hospitality.
  • Canara Bank: Planning to launch the IPO of Canara Robeco AMC.
  • Brigade Estate: Aiming for IPO of Brigade Hotels.
  • Greaves Cotton: Plans to raise Rs 1,000 crore through its subsidiary Greaves Electric Mobility Limited.
  • JSW Group: Set to launch the IPO of JSW Cement.

Additionally, other mainstream IPOs lined up for 2025 include LG Electronics India, NSDL, Dr Agarwal’s Health Care, Hexaware Technologies, and Aether Energies.

item.title: Hero Karizma 421 In Works? New Design Patent Reveals Details - NDTV
item.description:
Hero MotoCorp Develops New Karizma 421 Motorcycle

Publication Date: Not specified   |   Source: Not specified

Hero MotoCorp is expanding its premium motorcycle line with a potential new model, the Karizma 421, as indicated by a recently leaked design patent.

  • Hero MotoCorp plans to extend its motorcycle lineup with the Karizma nameplate.
  • A design patent reveals a new semi-faired motorcycle, possibly the Karizma 421.
  • The design shows significant features like wide handlebars, sharp fuel tank design, and an upright windshield.
  • The motorcycle appears to offer superior mechanical specifications compared to existing models.
  • The upcoming model might be powered by a new 421 cc engine.
“Hero MotoCorp might bring the semi-faired bike with the Karizma nameplate while keeping the XMR suffix reserved for the fully faired version.”

In conclusion, the Karizma 421 could be a significant addition to Hero's lineup, appealing to motorcycle enthusiasts looking for premium features.

item.title: India’s core sector growth rises to four-month high of 4.3% in November - Moneycontrol
item.description:
India’s Core Sector Growth Rises to 4.3% in November

Date: December 31, 2024

Source: Moneycontrol

India’s core sector growth rose to a four-month high of 4.3 percent in November, reflecting an upward trend compared to previous months.

  • Core sector growth increased from 3.7 percent in October.
  • This marks the third consecutive month of growth, attributed to a favorable base.
  • The eight core industries contribute significantly to India's industrial output, accounting for 40 percent of the industrial production index.
  • Industrial production had previously increased by 3.5 percent in October, bolstered by the festive season.
“November marks the third consecutive month of expansion owing to a favorable base.”

This growth in the core sector is a positive indicator for India's industrial recovery and economic performance.

item.title: New Year’s 2025: 8 cocktail recipes to celebrate in style - Recipes
item.description:
New Year’s 2025: 8 Cocktail Recipes to Celebrate in Style

Publication Date: Dec 31, 2024 | Source: Times of India

As we say goodbye to 2024 and embrace 2025, it is the perfect time to enhance your New Year's Eve celebration with savory cocktails. Whether you are hosting a large party or having an intimate gathering, these recipes will help you enjoy sophisticated flavors.

  • Sparkling Citrus Bellini: A refreshing mix of orange juice, grenadine, and sparkling wine.
  • Pomegranate Mojito: A delightful combination of muddled pomegranate seeds, mint, lime juice, rum, and club soda.
  • Ginger Pear Martini: Shake vodka, pear juice, and ginger syrup for a warming drink.
  • Cranberry Rosemary Spritz: A festive blend of cranberry juice, vodka, and sparkling water.
  • Hot Toddy Twist: A cozy mix of whiskey, honey, lemon, and hot water.
  • Espresso Martini Sparkle: A vibrant cocktail featuring espresso, vodka, and coffee liqueur with edible glitter.
  • Mango Chilli Margarita: A sweet and spicy concoction perfect for adventurous palates.
  • Blueberry Fizz: A colorful mix of muddled blueberries, gin, and club soda.

item.title: Transnet South Africa Posts Wider Loss Citing Hampered Recovery | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Transnet South Africa Reports Increase in Losses Due to Infrastructure Issues

Publication Date: October 2024, Source: Bloomberg

South Africa’s state-owned rail and ports operator, Transnet SOC Ltd., reported a widening loss in the first half of the financial year due to ongoing infrastructure and security issues.

Key Points:

  • First-half loss increased to 2.2 billion rand ($118 million) from 1.6 billion rand a year earlier.
  • Transnet received waivers from banks to avoid default after breaching loan covenants.
  • Rail inefficiencies cost the South African economy over 400 billion rand in 2022.
  • The mining sector reported a shortfall of 50 billion rand in export targets.
  • Transnet is focusing on improving infrastructure and rolling stock availability.
“Significant work remains, particularly in areas including debt management and security,” Transnet stated.

The ongoing challenges indicate that while efforts have been made towards recovery, substantial issues continue to impede progress.

item.title: Market Wrap, December 31: SENSEX, NIFTY50 end lower but gain nearly 9% in 2024; mid and small caps outperform by large margin - Upstox
item.description:
Market Wrap, December 31: SENSEX and NIFTY50 Close Lower, Yet Gain Nearly 9% for the Year

Publication Date: December 31, 2024
Source: [Source Not Provided]

On the last trading day of 2024, the Indian equity markets closed lower, with declines mainly attributed to selling pressure in IT stocks. Despite the downturn, both the SENSEX and NIFTY recorded substantial gains over the year.

Key Points:

  • The S&P BSE SENSEX ended at 78,139.01, down 109 points (0.14%), while the NIFTY50 closed at 23,644.80, down 0.10 points.
  • The BSE Information Technology index fell 1.29%, closing at 43,187.78.
  • For 2024, SENSEX gained 8.2% and NIFTY50 gained 8.9%, marking the ninth consecutive year of positive returns.
  • In December's session, 28 of the NIFTY50 constituents advanced, while 22 declined.
  • Stocks hitting 52-week highs included 127 listings, with 102 stocks reaching 52-week lows.
  • The NIFTY MIDCAP 100 index rose by 0.02%, and the NIFTY SMALLCAP 100 index increased by 0.69%, both gaining nearly 24% for the year.

Notable Quotes or Statistics:

“The benchmark indices corrected more than 10% from their peak hit in September 2024.”

Conclusion:

Despite a subdued year-end close, the overall annual performance was respectable, with mid and small-cap stocks significantly outperforming their larger counterparts.

item.title: Taking Stock | Sensex, Nifty end 2024 with decent gains, clock ninth straight year of positive returns - Moneycontrol

item.title: Indian rupee may face pressure in 2025 as strong dollar, geopolitics, and RBI interventions shape outlook - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Indian rupee may face pressure in 2025 as strong dollar, geopolitics, and RBI interventions shape outlook

Date: December 31, 2024 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Indian rupee is expected to remain under pressure in 2025 due to a strong dollar along with geopolitical tensions and central bank interventions.

  • The Reserve Bank of India is likely to intervene in the currency market to mitigate volatility.
  • Expectations of a strong dollar are arising from US economic policies under the new administration.
  • Geopolitical factors and the upcoming Indian Union Budget are crucial for the rupee's movement.
“Exogenous factors are likely to play a greater role in the rupee’s weakness going ahead, particularly the Fed’s trajectory and the US government policies under the new President will be important.” - Aditi Gupta, economist at Bank of Baroda

The outlook for the Indian rupee indicates a challenging environment influenced by global economic factors and domestic policy decisions.

item.title: India again delays rules to break PhonePe-Google Pay duopoly - TechCrunch
item.description:
India Again Delays Rules to Break PhonePe-Google Pay Duopoly

Date: December 31, 2024

Source: TechCrunch

India has once again pushed back a contentious plan to limit major technology companies’ control of the nation’s digital payments system, extending a regulatory uncertainty that has weighed on the sector for years. The National Payments Corporation of India has extended the deadline for implementing a 30% cap on any individual app’s share of transactions on the Unified Payments Interface (UPI) to December 31, 2026.

  • The decision provides temporary relief to Walmart-backed PhonePe and Google Pay, which together handle more than 85% of transactions on UPI.
  • The UPI network processes over 13 billion transactions monthly, integral to India’s digital economy.
  • Regulators have struggled to find a solution to implement market share restrictions without disrupting services for millions of users.
  • India has also lifted restrictions on WhatsApp’s mobile payments service, allowing it to roll out to over 500 million users.
"The market share limits were first proposed in 2020... this decision marks another delay in India’s efforts to check the growing power of global technology giants in its booming digital economy."

The extension provides crucial clarity for PhonePe as it prepares for an initial public offering, previously hindered by regulatory uncertainty.

item.title: WhatsApp permitted to expand WhatsApp Pay to all users in India - TechCrunch
item.description:
WhatsApp Granted Approval to Offer Payments to All Users in India

Date: Tuesday, [publication date unknown]
Source: TechCrunch

India has lifted restrictions on WhatsApp’s payment service, paving the way for the app's expansion in its largest market.

  • The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has allowed WhatsApp to roll out its payment service to all users.
  • The previous limit of 100 million users has been removed, enhancing WhatsApp's competition against fintech rivals.
  • India's UPI platform processes over 13 billion transactions monthly but is largely dominated by Google Pay and PhonePe.
  • The NPCI has postponed implementing a 30% transaction cap for two years, staving off further market regulation.
“Our goal is to add value and convenience to users’ lives through various use-cases like bill payments, ticket booking, and shopping.” - WhatsApp spokesperson

This approval marks a significant move in WhatsApp's efforts to establish itself in India's rapidly growing digital payment landscape.

item.title: GCCs outpace IT in 2024; way ahead in job addition, market cap - Moneycontrol
item.description:
GCCs Outpace IT in 2024; Way Ahead in Job Addition, Market Cap

Date: December 31, 2024 / Source: Moneycontrol

Global Capability Centres (GCCs) are powering the next wave of software job creation, outpacing the traditional information technology (IT) sector in 2024...

  • India has added over three lakh employees and nearly $20 billion in market capitalization in 2024.
  • IT companies have added less than a lakh in headcount and just $6 billion in market value during the same period.
  • The IT industry is facing demand pressure due to a macroeconomic slowdown in North America and Europe.
  • Nilesh Thakker from Zinnov emphasizes India's solidification as the 'GCC Hotspot of the World.'
"India today has solidified its position as the 'GCC Hotspot of the World.'" - Nilesh Thakker

This shift marks a significant transformation in the job market, indicating a robust growth trajectory for GCCs despite challenges faced by the IT sector.
